definition: open shelves (in self-service store or user access library)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to support/frame/rack/framework/classifier for planes, large vehicles, radios etc
to assume a fighting stance/(fig.) to take the offensive

sentences.english: Open-shelf-borrowing brings new requirements to the humanization construction in circulation department in library.
sentences.chinese: 开架借阅给流通部的人性化建设带来了新的要求。

sentences.english: Most libraries have open and closed stacks.
sentences.chinese: 多数图书馆有开架和闭架两种书库。

sentences.english: The exercise of open-shelf book borrowing marks the developmental orientation of library service.
sentences.chinese: 图书开架借阅是图书馆服务工作的发展方向。

definition: reasonably priced/inexpensive/to keep prices down/(currency exchange) parity
Nivea, skin and body care brand
sales counter dedicated to a certain kind of product (e.g. alcohol)
